meanings.definition: To form or unite in a group for a common purpose, especially for a hostile or aggressive purpose.
meanings.sent1: The students were brigading to protest against the new school rules.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were brigading together to plan their attack on the enemy.
meanings.sent3: Brigading for a surprise birthday party can be tricky but fun.
meanings.sent4: The ants were brigading towards the picnic area, ready to claim their share of the food.
meanings.sent5: The fans were brigading outside the concert venue, eagerly waiting for their favorite band.

meanings.definition: The act of organizing a group of people to engage in coordinated online harassment or manipulation.
meanings.sent1: The brigading of trolls on social media platforms can have harmful effects on individuals.
meanings.sent2: The company detected a case of brigading aimed at spreading false information online.
meanings.sent3: The online gamers joked about brigading each other in a virtual battle.
meanings.sent4: The brigading of fake accounts flooded the comment section with spam.
meanings.sent5: The investigation revealed a sophisticated brigading operation targeting political discussions.
